description:
From patch 4 in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/55251/
From http://logs.openstack.org/51/55251/4/check/check-grenade-devstack-vm/35a5476/console.html

2013-11-12 12:26:01.889 | The following services are not running after upgrade:  nova-conductor

This can be seen in the new n-cpu log:

2013-11-12 12:25:45.354 WARNING nova.conductor.api [req-ec7a159c-5dad-4eda-9aa6-b98d6ba0d1f1 None None] Timed out waiting for nova-conductor. Is it running? Or did this service start before nova-conductor?
title: nova-conductor did not start after upgrade

comments.content:
From patch 4 in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/55251/
From http://logs.openstack.org/51/55251/4/check/check-grenade-devstack-vm/35a5476/console.html

2013-11-12 12:26:01.889 | The following services are not running after upgrade:  nova-conductor

This can be seen in the new n-cpu log:

2013-11-12 12:25:45.354 WARNING nova.conductor.api [req-ec7a159c-5dad-4eda-9aa6-b98d6ba0d1f1 None None] Timed out waiting for nova-conductor. Is it running? Or did this service start before nova-conductor?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~david-kranz

comments.content: FWIW, I've seen this in the nova compute logs for a long time, conductor starts, I think it's just some timing issue between when the nova compute and conductor services start.  I generally order them such that compute starts last, or at least after api/scheduler/conductor services.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
Seeing it here for nova-compute also:

http://logs.openstack.org/42/79842/1/check/check-grenade-dsvm-partial-ncpu/d0f1689/console.html#_2014-03-12_05_13_53_430
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content: Related to bug 1285323 but that's failing to stop services on the old workspace, this is failing to start services on the new workspace.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
The warning from compute is not fatal and is definitely expected in cases where they are started in the wrong order or mostly at the same time (i.e. you will always see this in devstack).

Has this happened recently? If so, looking at some logs might give us more details, but I don't think there is enough here to go on right now.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~danms

comments.content: Marking this as invalid since there was no follow up to the question of recurrence in the last three months.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~danms

comments.content:
This grenade bug was last updated over 180 days ago, as grenade
is a fast moving project and we'd like to get the tracker down to
currently actionable bugs, this is getting marked as Invalid. If the
issue still exists, please feel free to reopen it.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sdague
